intro: Monustes australis, commonly known as the Australian starfruit, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped fruits that are edible. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has small, narrow leaves with a glossy surface. It produces white flowers that bloom in spring, followed by the development of its distinctive fruit. The fruit is often used in culinary applications due to its tart and tangy flavor.
